name: Opacity
description:
A widget that makes its child partially transparent. 
This class paints its child into an intermediate buffer and then blends the child back into the scene partially transparent.

name: SafeArea
description:
A widget that insets its child by sufficient padding to avoid intrusions by the operating system.
For example, this will indent the child by enough to avoid the status bar at the top of the screen.
It will also indent the child by the amount necessary to avoid The Notch on the iPhone X, or other similar creative physical features of the display.

name: Expanded
description:
A widget that expands a child of a Row, Column, or Flex so that the child fills the available space. 
Using an Expanded widget makes a child of a Row, Column, or Flex expand to fill the available space along the main axis (e.g., horizontally for a Row or vertically for a Column). 
If multiple children are expanded, the available space is divided among them according to the flex factor.

name: Hero
description: Hero transitions are a common UI pattern. They let the user know that they changed screens, while keeping the focus of the interaction front and center. Flutterâ€™s Hero widget will automatically create a hero transition between two navigator routes.

name: AnimatedContainer
description:
Animated version of Container that gradually changes its values over a period of time. 
The AnimatedContainer will automatically animate between the old and new values of properties when they change using the provided curve and duration. 
Properties that are null are not animated. Its child and descendants are not animated.

name: Opacity
description:
A widget that makes its child partially transparent. 
This class paints its child into an intermediate buffer and then blends the child back into the scene partially transparent.

name: Center
description: A widget to center all its child elements

name: FlutterLogo
description: The Flutter logo, in widget form.

name: HeroMode
description: Enables or disables Heroes in the widget subtree.

name: SingleChildScrollView
description: Allows user to scroll the flutter page.

name: AnimatedPhysicalModel
description: The color is animated if the animateColor property is set; otherwise, the color changes immediately at the start of the animation for the other two properties. This allows the color to be animated independently (e.g. because it is being driven by an AnimatedTheme).

name: CupertinoPopupSurface class
description: Rounded rectangle surface that looks like an iOS popup surface, e.g., alert dialog and action sheet.

name: AnimatedList
description: Use AnimatedList to make your lists more dynamic. You can use it to animate your lists when inserting or removing items.

name: Wrap
description: The Wrap widget lays out its children like a row or column, but when it runs out of room, it wraps to the next line. Direction, alignment, and spacing properties can help you get the exact look you need.

name: ClipOval
description: By default, inscribes an axis-aligned oval into its layout dimensions and prevents its child from painting outside that oval, but the size and location of the clip oval can be customized using a custom clipper.

name: Table
description: A table allows the user to arrange the data in rows and columns. It is used to store and display our data in a structured format, which helps us to compare the pairs of related values easily.

name: ConstrainedBox
description: A widget that imposes additional constraints on its child.

name: SnackBar
description: SnackBar lets you pop up a message for a few seconds at the bottom of your app.

name: AboutDialog
description: An about box. This is a dialog box with the application's icon, name, version number, and copyright, plus a button to show licenses for software used by the application.

name: BackdropFilter
description: A widget that applies a filter to the existing painted content and then paints child.

name: Text
description: The Text widget displays a string of text with single style.

name: Layout
description: This bundle of widgets helps in placing the other widgets on the screen as needed

name: AssetImage
description: Fetches an image from an AssetBundle, having determined the exact image to use based on the context.

name: RefreshIndicator
description: A widget that supports the Material 'swipe to refresh' idiom.

name: RichText Class
description: A paragraph of rich text.

name: AppBar
description: Topmost component of the app

name: Paint class
description: style to use when drawing on a Canvas

name: Padding
description: Topmost component of the app

name: Flow
description: The Flow widget that sizes and positions children efficiently.

name: margin
description: Margin has multiple meanings. In business, margin is the profit generated after accounting for costs, which is expressed as a percentage.

name: Mediaquery
description: Establishes a subtree in which media queries resolve to the given data.

name: BottomSheet
description: A Material Design bottom sheet.The BottomSheet widget itself is rarely used directly. Instead, prefer to create a persistent bottom sheet with ScaffoldState.showBottomSheet or Scaffold.bottomSheet, and a modal bottom sheet with showModalBottomSheet.

name: pratiksha
description:
A widget that insets its child by sufficient padding to avoid intrusions by the operating system.
For example, this will indent the child by enough to avoid the status bar at the top of the screen.
It will also indent the child by the amount necessary to avoid The Notch on the iPhone X, or other similar creative physical features of the display.

name: RichText
description: The RichText widget displays text that uses multiple different styles.

name: async
description: async patterns to your flutter application.

name: FadeInImage
description: When displaying images using the default Image widget, you might notice they simply pop onto the screen as theyâ€™re loaded. This might feel visually jarring to your users. Instead, wouldnâ€™t it be nice to display a placeholder at first, and images would fade in as theyâ€™re loaded? Use the FadeInImage widget for exactly this purpose.

name: FutureBuilder
description: FutureBuilder is a Widget that will help you to execute some asynchronous function and based on that function's result your UI will update.

name: MediaQuery class
description: Establishes a subtree in which media queries resolve to the given data.

name: AboutDialog
description: An about box. This is a dialog box with the application's icon, name, version number, and copyright, plus a button to show licenses for software used by the application.

name: DemonSlayer
description:
Best anime to watch. 
The AnimatedContainer will automatically animate between the old and new values of properties when they change using the provided curve and duration. 
Properties that are null are not animated. Its child and descendants are not animated.

name: FutureBuilder
description: FutureBuilder is a Widget that will help you to execute some asynchronous function and based on that function's result your UI will update.

name: MediaQuery class
description: MediaQuery class establishes a subtree in which media queries resolve to the given data

name: Scrollable
description: Scrollable implements the interaction model for a scrollable widget, including gesture recognition, but does not have an opinion about how the viewport, which actually displays the children, is constructed.

name: Align
description: A widget that aligns its child within itself and optionally sizes itself based on the child's size.

name: Transform
description: A widget that applies a transformation before painting its child. Unlike RotatedBox, which applies a rotation prior to layout, this object applies its transformation just prior to painting, which means the transformation is not taken into account when calculating how much space this widget's child consumes.

name: AspectRatio
description: A widget that attempts to size the child to a specific aspect ratio. The widget first tries the largest width permitted by the layout constraints. The height of the widget is determined by applying the given aspect ratio to the width, expressed as a ratio of width to height.

name: Form
description: An optional container for grouping together multiple form field widgets (e.g. TextField widgets). Each individual form field should be wrapped in a FormField widget, with the Form widget as a common ancestor of all of those

name: ClipRRect
description: A widget that clips its child using a rounded rectangle. By default, ClipRRect uses its own bounds as the base rectangle for the clip, but the size and location of the clip can be customized using a custom clipper.
